articleContent.title: Chord: Major 7th in A# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Major 7th in A# (Shape: C)

## Brief Description
The A# Major 7th chord, based on the C shape, is a beautiful and sophisticated chord that adds a jazzy and dreamy flavor to your music. It is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and soul genres to create lush harmonic textures and convey a sense of sophistication.

## Notes and Intervals
The A# Major 7th chord in the C shape consists of the following notes and intervals:
- A# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G (Perfect 5th)
- C (Major 7th)

## Musical Flavor
The Major 7th chord in A# using the C shape provides a rich and colorful sound to your music. It has a smooth and classy quality that can evoke emotions of nostalgia and romance. The major 7th interval introduces a sense of tension and resolution, adding depth and complexity to your musical compositions.

## 3 Songs Featuring A# Major 7th (C shape)
1. **"Blue in Green" by Miles Davis**: This jazz ballad features lush Major 7th chords, including the A# Major 7th in the C shape, creating a melancholic and introspective atmosphere.
   
2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones**: In this soulful song, the A# Major 7th chord in the C shape is used to enhance the smooth and mellow vibe of the music.
   
3. **"Ain't No Sunshine" by Bill Withers**: This classic R&B track utilizes the A# Major 7th chord in the C shape to add sophistication and soulfulness to the chord progressions.
